text: Remove row or column from 2D list if all values (in that row or column) are None

code:
grid = [
        [None, None, None, None, None],
        [None, None, None, None, None],
        [None, None, None, None, None],
        [None, None, None, None, None],
        [None, None, None, None, None],
        [None, None, None, None, None],
        ]

text: I augment the grid and it might turn into something like:

code:
grid = [
        [{"some" : "thing"}, None, None, None, None],
        [None, None, None, None, None],
        [None, None, None, None, None],
        [None, None, None, {"something" : "else"}, None],
        [None, {"another" : "thing"}, None, None, None],
        [None, None, None, None, None],
        ]

text: I want to remove entire rows and columns that have all Nones in them.
So in the previous code, grid would be transformed into:
I removed row 1, 2, 5 (zero indexed) and column 2 and 4.
The way I am deleting the rows now:

code:
for row in range(6):
    if grid[row] == [None, None, None, None, None]:
        del grid[row]

text: I don't have a decent way of deleting None columns yet.
Is there a "pythonic" way of doing this?
